content: If it's not a fuck yes, it's a no.
author: Mark Manson

content: You do not rise to the level of your goals, you fall down to the level of your systems.
author: James Clear

content: What you do is what matters, not what you think or say or plan.
author: Jason Fried

content: You can do anything, but not everything. Prioritize better.
author: David Allen

content: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Confucius

content: You can't win the game, if you don't play.
author: Don Diego Garcia

content: If not now, when?
author: Eckhart Tolle

content: Remembering the past and imagining the future is not a problem, but when you try to live in the past and the future, it is the problem.
author: Sadhguru

content: Whatever you do willingly, you enjoy. Whatever you do unwillingly, you suffer.
author: Sadhguru

content: If you do not know how to be still, you can only be ill.
author: Sadhguru

content: When I stop thinking then I really am.
author: Yogic Proverb

content: The trouble is, you think you have time.
author: Buddha

content: Writing creates precision of thoughts.
author: Robin Sharma

content: Procrastinating is a vice for productivity. But it can be a virtue for creativity.
author: Adam Grant

content: A personal metric: how much of the day is spent doing things out of obligation rather than out of interest?
author: Naval Ravikant

content: If you do what you’ve always done, you’ll get what you’ve always gotten.
author: Tony Robbins

content: You don’t rise to the level of your expectations. You fall to the level of your training.
author: David Goggins

content: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

content: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma – which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
author: Steve Jobs

content: Someday is not a day in the week.
author: Sam Horn

content: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
author: Jim Rohn

content: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

content: The feeling that any task is a nuisance will soon disappear if it is done in mindfulness.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

content: You cannot control the results, only your actions.
author: Allan Lokos

content: You only lose what you cling to.
author: Buddha

content: Be where you are, otherwise you will miss your life.
author: Buddha

content: If the problem can be solved, why worry? If the problem cannot be solved, worrying will do you no good.
author: Buddha

content: Relentlessly prune bullshit, don't wait to do things that matter, and savor the time you have. That's what you do when life is short.
author: Paul Graham

content: More is lost by indecision than wrong decision.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
author: Lyndon Johnson

content: Twenty years from now you’ll be more disappointed by the things you did not do than the ones you did.
author: Mark Twain

content: If there is no wind, row.
author: Latin Proverb

content: There are two rules for success: 1. Never reveal everything you know.
author: Roger H. Lincoln

content: The ultimate productivity hack is saying no.
author: James Clear

content: If you make a mistake and do not correct it, this is called a mistake.
author: Confucius

content: Life is short. Smile while you still have teeth.
author: Mallory Hopkins

content: If you don't stand for something, you will fall for anything.
author: Mark Manson

content: If what one has to say is not better than silence, then one should keep silent.
author: Confucius

content: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
author: Jason Fried

content: The man who chases two rabbits, catches neither.
author: David Allen

content: Better light a candle than curse the darkness.
author: Confucius

content: Play stupid games, win stupid prizes.
author: Don Diego Garcia

content: Read what you love until you love to read.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: A calm mind, a fit body, and a house full of love. These things cannot be bought. They must be earned.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Lifehack: When in bed, meditate. Either you will have a deep meditation or fall asleep. Victory either way.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: If there’s something you want to do later, do it now. There is no “later.”
author: Sadhguru

content: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
author: Yogic Proverb

content: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Buddha

content: Until we have begun to go without them, we fail to realize how unnecessary many things are. We've been using them not because we needed them but because we had them.
author: Robin Sharma

content: The smarter you get, the slower you read.
author: Adam Grant

content: Every second you have on this planet is very precious, and it’s your responsibility to make sure you’re happy and interpret everything in the best possible way.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You should be far more concerned with your current trajectory than with your current results.
author: Tony Robbins

content: You're going to pay a price for every bloody thing you do and everything you don't do. You don't get to choose to not pay a price. You get to choose which poison you're going to take. That's it.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: You can only find out what you actually believe (rather than what you think you believe) by watching how you act. You simply don’t know what you believe, before that. You are too complex to understand yourself.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: No tree can grow to Heaven, unless its roots reach down to Hell.
author: Steve Jobs

content: In order to be able to think, you have to risk being offensive.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Rules are there for a reason. You are only allowed to break them if you are a master. If you’re not a master, don’t confuse your ignorance with creativity or style.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Telling people you’re virtuous isn’t a virtue, it’s self-promotion. Virtue signalling is not virtue. Virtue signalling is, quite possibly, our commonest vice.
author: Chinese Proverb

content: Don't count chickens before they hatch.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

content: Where there's a will, there's a way.
author: Allan Lokos

content: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush.
author: Buddha

content: The grass is always greener on the other side of the fence.
author: Buddha

content: Strike while the iron is hot.
author: Buddha

content: Too many cooks spoil the broth.
author: Paul Graham

content: You can't have your cake and eat it too.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

content: Beggars can't be choosers.
author: Lyndon Johnson

content: When in Rome, do as the Romans do.
author: Mark Twain

content: Don't cross the bridge until you come to it.
author: Latin Proverb

content: Don't make a mountain out of an anthill.
author: Roger H. Lincoln

content: The early bird catches the worm.
author: James Clar

content: Better late than never.
author: Confucis

content: Two wrongs don't make a right.
author: Proverb

content: It's better to be safe than sorry.
author: Proverb

content: Don't bite the hand that feeds you.
author: Proverb

content: Squeaky wheel gets the grease.
author: Proverb

content: Don't bite off more than you can chew.
author: Proverb

content: Actions speak louder than words.
author: Proverb

content: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
author: Provrb

content: Still waters run deep.
author: Proverb

content: If it isn't broke, don't fix it.
author: Proverb

content: Learn to walk before you run.
author: Proverb

content: Out of sight, out of mind.
author: Proverb

content: Measure twice, cut once.
author: Proverb

content: No man is fit to command another that cannot command himself.
author: William Penn

content: Among the blind the one-eyed man is king.
author: Proverb

content: A tree is known by its fruit.
author: Bible

content: Better a little fire to warm us, than a great one to burn us.
author: Irish Proverb

content: Better to reign in hell, than serve in heaven.
author: John Milton

content: Eat water and drink food.
author: Indian Proverb

content: Head and feet keep warm, the rest will take no harm.
author: Proverb

content: Health is not valued till sickness comes.
author: Thomas Fuller

content: Keep no more cats than will catch mice.
author: Proverb

content: You can’t wake a person who is pretending to be asleep.
author: Navajo Proverb

content: Don’t have too many irons in the fire.
author: Proverb

content: If you know how to manage this moment, you know how to manage your life.
author: Sadhguru

content: Open your mouth only if what you are going to say is more beautiful than silence.
author: Arabic Proverb

content: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

content: Set your house in order, before you criticize the world.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Tell the truth. Or at least don't lie.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Questions you cannot answer are usually far better for you than answers you cannot question.
author: Yuval Noah Harari

content: Do lesser. Think slower. Feel faster. Sense more. Read smarter. Write sharper. Listen longer. Speak truer.
author: Proverb

content: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing. That's why we recommend it daily.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: There are two ways to conquer and enslave a country. One is by the sword. The other is by debt.
author: John Adams

content: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.
author: Mark Twain

content: You are misunderstanding relaxation as laxity and attention as tension.
author: Sadhguru

content: What happens to a man is less important than what happens within him.
author: Louis L. Mann

content: All the problems in the world originate because of the man’s inability to be alone in a room with himself.
author: Blaise Pascal

content: You know what the worst mistake in life is being afraid to make one.
author: Mike Mentzer

content: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
author: Dale Carnegie

content: A problem well defined is already half solved.
author: Charles Kettering

content: We only have now! Everything else is either imagination or memory.
author: Steve Maraboli

content: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
author: William Shakespeare

content: Hurrying and delaying are alike ways of trying to resist the present.
author: Alan Watts

content: The time you enjoy wasting, is not wasted time.
author: John Lennon

content: Experience is what you get, when you don't get what you wanted.
author: Randy Pausch

content: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you can see.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Don't live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
author: Robin Sharma

content: When goods do not cross borders, soldiers will.
author: Frederic Bastiat

content: Minimalism is the intentional promotion of things we most value and removal of anything that distracts us from it.
author: Joshua Becker

content: Letting go can be painful, but not letting go can be even more painful.
author: The Minimalists

content: If the only tool you have is a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

content: What a man can be, he must be. This need we call self-actualization.
author: Abraham Maslow

content: If you think fitness is expensive, try illness.
author: Sylvester Stallone

content: An ounce of experience is worth tons of theory.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: A person who won't read has no advantage over a person who can't read.
author: Mark Twain

content: It isn't what the book costs. It's what it will cost you if you don't read it.
author: Jim Rohn

content: The ultimate truth of who you are is not in I am this or I am that, but I Am.
author: Eckhart Tolle

content: A man asked Gautama Buddha, ‘I want happiness.’ Buddha said, ‘First remove I, that’s Ego, then remove Want, that’s Desire. See now you are left with Happiness.’
author: Buddha

content: After a time, you may find that having is not so pleasing a thing after all as wanting.
author: Spock

content: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end of it.
author: Spock

content: It doesn’t matter what we want. Once we get it, we want something else.
author: Lord Baelish

content: Risk everything for awareness, but never risk awareness for anything. There is no other value which is higher than awareness.
author: Osho

content: If you are alive, you will change. If you are dead, of course you cannot change. The moment you have stopped changing, you have died. Many people die near about thirty years of age. Then they may live fifty years more. But that is a posthumous life.
author: Osho

content: There is a skill to Learning. It is all about what is and what is not. While Science is knowing what is, Art is creating what is not.
author: Shri Shri Ravi Shankar

content: If you don’t say the things you believe, you come to believe the things you say.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Destiny is what every human being creates for oneself. Fate is when you fail to create your destiny.
author: Sadhguru

content: The less rigid your personality, the more powerful your presence.
author: Sadhguru

content: The more you know, the more you know you don’t know.
author: Aristotle

content: He who has a why can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Absence of evidence is not evidence of absence.
author: Carl Sagan

content: It is not the amount of action, but the depth of experience that makes life rich and fulfilling.
author: Sadhguru

content: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
author: James Clear

content: Your body and soul are not two different things. The body is the visible soul. The soul is the invisible body.
author: Osho

content: ‘Now’ is the only reality and ‘Here’ is the only existence. Desire takes you away.
author: Osho

content: Life is a game in which the rules change as the game progresses, and you have to know where you are in the game to know what rules to play by. Furthermore, you can't ever be certain where you are in the game, and the rules don't always apply.
author: Dr. Brad Blanton

content: Who you are should become more of a description centered in here and now, and less of a story about your life.
author: Dr. Brad Blanton

content: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.
author: Rumi

content: When diet is wrong, medicine is of no use. When diet is correct, medicine is of no need.
author: Ayurvedic Proverb

content: Sex in the body is fine. Money in the pocket is fine. They only become a problem if they enter your mind.
author: Sadhguru

content: Money and success don’t change people; they merely amplify what is already there.
author: Will Smith

content: Not how long, but how well you have lived is the main thing.
author: Seneca

content: Life’s tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: The secret of happiness, you see is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.
author: Socrates

content: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

content: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

content: The most wasted of days is one without laughter.
author: E. E. Cummings

content: You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need.
author: Vernon Howard

content: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

content: Time is what we want most and what we use worst.
author: William Penn

content: To learn a language is to have one more window from which to look at the world.
author: Chinese Proverb

content: You don’t have a soul. You are a soul. You have a body.
author: C. S. Lewis

content: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.
author: Carl Jung

content: Do you think it is better to fail at something worthwhile, or succeed at something meaningless.
author: Tommy Wallach

content: Too many people buy things they don’t need with money they don’t have to impress people they don’t like.
author: Dave Ramsey

content: When the whole world is silent, even one voice becomes powerful.
author: Malala Yousafzai

content: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

content: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: Don't let schooling interfere with your education.
author: Mark Twain

content: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius

content: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucious

content: In a country well governed, poverty is something to be ashamed of. In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of.
author: Confucious

content: The beginning of wisdom is to call things by their proper name.
author: Confucious

content: Wealth creation is an evolutionarily recent positive-sum game. Status is an old zero-sum game. Those attacking wealth creation are often just seeking status.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The business world has many people playing zero sum games and a few playing positive sum games searching for each other in the crowd.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The three big ones in life are wealth, health, and happiness. We pursue them in that order, but their importance is reverse.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: A rational person can find peace by cultivating indifference to things outside of their control.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The fundamental delusion: There is something out there that will make me happy and fulfilled forever.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Desire is a contract you make with yourself to be unhappy until you get what you want.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The reality is life is a single-player game. You’re born alone. You’re going to die alone. All of your interpretations are alone. All your memories are alone. You’re gone in three generations, and nobody cares. Before you showed up, nobody cared. It’s all single player.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: An emotion is our evolved biology predicting the future impact of a current event. In modern settings, it’s usually exaggerated or wrong.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Meditation is intermittent fasting for the mind.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: A taste of freedom can make you unemployable.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The modern struggle: Lone individuals summoning inhuman willpower, fasting, meditating, and exercising. Up against armies of scientists and statisticians weaponizing abundant food, screens, and medicine into junk food, clickbait news, infinite porn, endless games, and addictive drugs.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
author: Seneca

content: The only true test of intelligence is if you get what you want out of life.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Specialisation is for insects. I don't believe in this model of trying to focus your life down one thing. You've got one life just do everything you want.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You're going to die one day and none of this is going to matter.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: As long as you are doing what you want, it's not a waste of time.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: When you have something to say, silence is a lie.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: It took untold generations to get you where you are. A little gratitude might be in order. If you're going to insist on bending the world to your way, you better have your reasons.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Perhaps you are overvaluing what you don’t have and undervaluing what you do.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Experience is the best teacher, and the worst experiences teach the best lessons.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: You know that song you can’t get out of your head? All thoughts work that way. Careful what you read.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Some of the best things that have happened to me are some of the worst things that have happened to me.
author: Andrew Tate

content: It is preferable to be roughly right than precisely wrong.
author: John Maynard Keynes

content: He who says he can and he who says he can't, are both usually right.
author: Confucius

content: I'd rather be an optimist proved wrong, than a pessimist proved right.
author: Tom Foolery

content: No such thing as spare time. No such thing as free time. No such thing as down time. All you got is lifetime.
author: Henry Rollins

content: If you look at what you have in life, you'll always have more. If you look at what you don't have in life, you'll never have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: Most people overestimate what they can do in one year and underestimate what they can do in ten years.
author: Bill Gates

content: If you exaggerate sex, you will be perverted in your mind. If you supress it, you will be even more perverted in your mind.
author: Sadhguru

content: Whether you think you can or think you can’t, you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

content: The full path of growth from birth to maturity consists of: 1. The birth of being. 2. The growth of the mind. 3. A period of domination of the being by the mind. 4. Liberation of the being from the mind. 5. A mind used by the being.
author: Brad Blanton

content: If you ran into an asshole in the morning you ran into an asshole. If you run into assholes all day, you're the asshole.
author: Tim Ferriss

content: I would rather have questions that can’t be answered than answers that can’t be questioned.
author: Richard Feynman

content: I learned very early the difference between knowing the name of something and knowing something.
author: Richard Feynman

content: The Universe is under no obligation to make sense to you.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

content: Reality is not absolute. So always beware of speaking in absolute terms. In other words, never use the following two words. 'Always' and 'Never'.
author: Proverb

content: There are three things in life that are most important. Healthy body. Calm mind. Happy emotion. And beyond a certain basic level, no amount of money can buy you any one of these things. If you don't have any one of these things and even if you have everything else in the world, then those things become worthless.
author: Proverb

content: Death is an absence of experience. Enlightenment is an experience of absence.
author: Anonymous

content: What I think is Ego. What I am is Consciousness.
author: Anonymous

content: Hard times create strong men. Strong men create easy times. Easy times create weak men. Weak men create hard times.
author: G. Michael Hopf

content: The same boiling water that softens the potato hardens the egg. It’s what you’re made of. Not the circumstances.
author: Mel Robbins

content: People who wonder if the glass is half empty or full miss the point. The glass is refillable.
author: Simon Sinek

content: Masculinity is toxic, until your country needs defending.
author: Anonymous

content: Borrowed garments never fit well.
author: Proverb

content: A jack of all trades is master of none.
author: Proverb

content: A journey of thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

content: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
author: Proverb

content: Persuasion is better than force.
author: Proverb

content: Words must be weighed, not counted.
author: Yiddish proverb

content: When the last tree is cut down, the last fish eaten, and the last stream poisoned, you will realize that you cannot eat money.
author: Native American Proverb

content: One shouldn’t miss the forest for the trees.
author: Proverb

content: The forbidden fruit is always the sweetest.
author: Proverb

content: Vision without action is a dream. Action without vision is a nightmare.
author: Proverb

content: He that is too secure is not safe.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: Money spent on brain is never spent in vain.
author: Proverb

content: Everyone wants to go to heaven, but no one wants to die.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

content: One who eats only once is a Yogi (Enlightened). One who eats twice a day is a Bhogi (Indulger). One that eats thrice a day is a Rogi (Sick), and one who eats four times or more, carry him to the grave.
author: Yogic Proverb

content: Neither power nor poverty can make your life more magical or less torturous.
author: Shah Rukh Khan

content: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.
author: Bernard M. Baruch

content: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Watch your thoughts; they become words. Watch your words; they become actions. Watch your actions; they become habits. Watch your habits; they become character. Watch your character; it becomes your destiny.
author: Lao Tzu

content: The person who doesn’t make mistakes is unlikely to make anything.
author: Paul Arden

content: You have to dream before your dreams can come true.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

content: Your dream is not that you see when you sleep, it is one that doesn't let you sleep.
author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

content: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

content: He who sweats more in training, bleeds less in war.
author: Spartan Warriors

content: Remembering that you are going to die, is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.
author: Steve Jobs

content: One person with a commitment is worth more than 100 people who have only an interest.
author: Mary Crowley

content: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don’t try.
author: Beverly Sills

content: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: A man who is drenched is not afraid of the rain.
author: Pandit Amar Nath

content: The bigger the why, the easier the how.
author: Jim Rohn

content: If you wait for all the lights to turn green before starting your journey, you’ll never leave the driveway.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: One's own misdirected thought can do more harm than an enemy or an ill wisher.
author: Buddha

content: You won't be punished for your anger. You'll be punished by your anger.
author: Buddha

content: You only have to know one thing: You can learn anything.
author: Khan Academy Slogan

content: Your body, your mind, your emotions, your energy must take instructions from you. And nobody but you.
author: Sadhguru

content: An idiot with a plan can beat a genius without a plan.
author: Warren Buffett

content: Humility is not thinking less of yourself. It’s thinking of yourself less.
author: C. S. Lewis

content: It’s very easy to start a project. But it’s very difficult to finish a project.
author: Dandapani

content: The difference between an ordinary person and an extraordinary person lies in the degree of concentration.
author: Swami Vivekananda

content: Give a man a fish, he’ll eat for a day. Teach him to fish, he’ll eat for a lifetime.
author: Lao Tzu

content: Many people think they lack motivation when what they really lack is clarity.
author: James Clear

content: Never miss twice. Missing once is an accident. Missing twice is a start of a new habit.
author: James Clear

content: The more precisely you define the problem, the more easily you can find a solution.
author: James Clear

content: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

content: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: The concept is if anything is worth doing, then give it everything you've got or don't attempt it at all.
author: Mike Mentzer

content: The way to get started is to quit talking and start doing.
author: Walt Disney

content: I fear not the man who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10,000 times.
author: Bruce Lee

content: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

content: A lot of people are afraid to say what they want. That's why they don't get what they want.
author: Madonna

content: If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success.
author: James Cameron

content: Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do. Don't wish it were easier; wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

content: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

content: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

content: If something is important enough, even if the odds are against you, you should still do it.
author: Elon Musk

content: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
author: Lucille Ball

content: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
author: Og Mandino

content: Don't let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

content: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

content: Change before you have to.
author: Jack Welch

content: If you can’t fly, then run. If you can’t run, then walk. If you can’t walk, then crawl. But whatever you do, you have to keep moving forward.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

content: Wake up determined, go to bed satisfied.
author: Dwayne Johnson

content: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
author: Herman Melville

content: If there is no struggle, there is no progress.
author: Frederick Douglass

content: You can't go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.
author: C. S. Lewis

content: If your ship doesn’t come in, swim out to it.
author: Jonathan Winters

content: I’d rather regret the risks that didn’t work out than the chances I didn’t take at all.
author: Simone Biles

content: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

content: If you’re serious about changing your life, you’ll find a way. If you’re not, you’ll find an excuse.
author: Jen Sincero

content: If you run you stand a chance of losing, but if you don’t run you’ve already lost.
author: Barack Obama

content: You can never cross the ocean until you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Christopher Columbus

content: If you are facing in the right direction, all you need to do is keep on walking.
author: Buddha

content: You can’t stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

content: Never let success get to your head and never let failure get to your heart.
author: Drake

content: I learned a long time ago that there is something worse than missing the goal, and that’s not pulling the trigger.
author: Mia Hamm

content: If we take care of the moments, the years will take care of themselves.
author: Maria Edgeworth

content: If you are working on something exciting that you really care about, you don’t have to be pushed. The vision pulls you.
author: Steve Jobs

content: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

content: If your dreams don’t scare you, they are too small.
author: Richard Branson

content: You can have results or excuses. Not both.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

content: You must want to be a butterfly so badly, you are willing to give up being a caterpillar.
author: Trina Paulus

content: The master has failed more times than the beginner has even tried.
author: Stephen McCranie

content: If you believe it’ll work out, you’ll see opportunities. If you don’t believe it’ll work out, you’ll see obstacles.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: Without hustle, talent will only carry you so far.
author: Gary Vaynerchuk

content: You’ve got to get up every morning with determination if you’re going to go to bed with satisfaction.
author: George Lorimer

content: The best way to appreciate your job is to imagine yourself without one.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway.
author: Earl Nightingale

content: If you work on something a little bit every day, you end up with something that is massive.
author: Kenneth Goldsmith

content: Speak your mind, even if your voice shakes.
author: Maggie Kuhn

content: Most people are fast to stop you before you get started but hesitate to get in the way if you're moving.
author: Tim Ferriss

content: You don’t need to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

content: Be happy with what you have while working for what you want.
author: Helen Keller

content: You never know what you can do until you try.
author: William Cobbett

content: When someone tells me ‘no,’ it doesn’t mean I can’t do it, it simply means I can’t do it with them.
author: Karen E. Quinones Miller

content: Build your own dreams or someone else will hire you to build theirs.
author: Farrah Gray

content: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
author: Karen Lamb

content: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal. Nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong attitude.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: First, have a definite, clear practical ideal; a goal, an objective. Second, have the necessary means to achieve your ends; wisdom, money, materials, and methods. Third, adjust all your means to that end.
author: Aristotle

content: Fall 7 times, stand up 8.
author: Japanese Proverb

content: Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction.
author: George Horace Lorimer

content: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Ryun

content: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
author: Confucius

content: We waste our time with short-term thinking and busywork. Warren Buffett spends a year deciding and a day acting. That act lasts decades.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You can get almost anything you want out of life, as long as it’s one thing and you want it far more than anything else.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Easy choices, hard life. Hard choices, easy life.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Doctors won’t make you healthy. Nutritionists won’t make you slim. Teachers won’t make you smart. Gurus won’t make you calm. Mentors won’t make you rich. Trainers won’t make you fit. Ultimately, you have to take responsibility. Save yourself.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Impatience with actions, patience with results.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The current environment programs the brain, but the clever brain can choose its upcoming environment.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The better ambitions have to do with the development of character and ability, rather than status and power. Status you can lose. You carry character with you wherever you go, and it allows you to prevail against adversity.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Stop saying those things that make you weak and ashamed. Say only those things that make you strong. Do only those things that you could speak of with honour.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Control your emotions, control your mind, Control your mind, control your actions. Control your actions, control your life.
author: Anthony Pompliano

content: Today I will do what other's won't, so tomorrow I will do what others can't.
author: Jerry Rice

content: If you want to go quickly, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
author: African Proverb

content: It’s better to lose the battle and win the war.
author: Proverb

content: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
author: African Proverb

content: You reap what you sow.
author: Proverb

content: Haste makes waste.
author: Proverb

content: Better to wear out than to rust out.
author: Proverb

content: Discontent is the first step in progress.
author: Proverb

content: It’s not enough to learn how to ride, you must also learn how to fall.
author: Mexican Proverb

content: He who would eat the fruit must climb the tree. He who would search for pearls must dive the sea.
author: John Dryden

content: If you can’t go over, you must go under.
author: Jewish Proverb

content: Best is oftentimes the enemy of good.
author: Proverb

content: Put off for one day and ten days will pass.
author: Korean Proverb

content: In order to get where you want to go, you have to first leave where you are.
author: Proverb

content: First deserve. Then desire.
author: Proverb

content: Rome wasn't built in a day.
author: Proverb

content: They must hunger in winter who will not work in summer.
author: Proverb

content: You can’t have a million dollar dream on a minimum wage work ethic.
author: Stephen C. Hogan

content: Don’t stop when you are tired. Stop when you are done.
author: David Goggins

content: Break the rules. But don't break the laws.
author: Proverb

content: You can either experience the pain of discipline or the pain of regret. The choice is yours.
author: Anonymous

content: One day or day one. You decide.
author: Anonymous

content: Things may come to those who wait, but only the things left by those who hustle.
author: Proverb

content: Hustlers don’t sleep, they nap.
author: Anonymous

content: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Jerry Dunn

content: Whenever you find yourself doubting how far you can go, just remember how far you have come.
author: N. R. Walker

content: Everyone you meet always ask if you have a career, are married or own a house as if life was some kind of grocery list. But nobody ever asks if you are happy.
author: Heath Ledger

content: Care about what other people think about you and you will always be their prisoner.
author: Lao Tzu

content: The truth is everyone is going to hurt you, you just gotta find ones worth suffering for.
author: Bob Marley

content: You will never reach your destination if you stop and throw stones at every dog that barks on the way.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Nothing’s more fun than doing what people say you can’t do.
author: Marc and Angel

content: Weak people take revenge. Strong people forgive. Wise people ignore.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Do you have enemies? Good. That means you’ve stood up for something, sometime in your life.
author: Winston Churchill

content: You can be the ripest, juiciest peach in the world and there’s still going to be somebody who hates peaches.
author: Dita Von Tesse

content: You’ll never have to think outside the box if you refuse to let anyone build one around you.
author: Richard Branson

content: I’d rather be hated for who I am than be loved for who I’m not.
author: Kurt Cobain

content: Let people do what they need to do to make them happy, and do what you need to do to make you happy. The end.
author: The Doctor Asky

content: Three can keep a secret, if two of them are dead.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: Most people want to see you do better, but not better than them. Don't be surprised if your success turns friends into strangers. Everybody loves you, until you become competition.
author: Trent Shelton

content: If you want to be a leader of people, then you need to be a master of words.
author: Rich Dad

content: There are two kinds of people in this life: Those who walk into a room and say, “Well, here I am”. And those who walk in and say, “Ahh, there you are.”
author: Leil Lowndes

content: As a mountain of rock is unshaken by wind, so also, the wise are unperturbed by blame or by praise
author: Buddha

content: If you live in a forest and you become afraid of wild animals, something is wrong with you. If you live in a market and you become afraid of the noises, something is wrong with you. If you live in the town and you become afraid of other people's comments, something is wrong with you.
author: Sadhguru

content: When you're 20, you care what everyone thinks about you. When you're 40, you stop caring what everyone thinks about you. When you're 60, you realize no one was ever thinking about you in the first place.
author: Winston Churchill

content: If their absence brought you peace, then you didn't lose them.
author: Jim Carrey

content: In relationships, whenever either sex wins, then both sexes lose.
author: Dr. Warren Farrel

content: The weakness of man is the illusion of his strength and the strength of woman is the illusion of her weakness.
author: Dr. Warren Farrel

content: The razor blade is sharp but can’t cut a tree. The axe is strong but can’t cut hair. Everyone is important according to their own unique purpose. Never look down on anyone unless you’re admiring their shoes.
author: Lee Escobar

content: Once you are clear what you are doing and why, other people's opinions will not matter.
author: Sadhguru

content: Most people seem to believe that if a relationship doesn’t last until death, it’s a failure. But the only relationship that’s truly a failure is one that lasts longer than it should. The success of a relationship should be measured by its depth, not by its length.
author: Neil Strauss

content: You must be interested to be interesting.
author: Neil Strauss

content: It's better to create something and be criticized than to create nothing and criticize others.
author: Ricky Garvais

content: The secret to public speaking is to speak as if you were alone.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Signaling virtue is a vice.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: I believe that divorce should be celebrated more than a marriage because divorce happens out of knowledge and wisdom and marriage happens out of ignorance and stupidity.
author: Ram Gopal Varma

content: One of the unfortunate axioms of human behavior is that what others shame people for the most is usually what they’re doing or want to do in secret themselves.
author: Neil Strauss

content: Remember that if you don’t prioritize your life, someone else will.
author: Greg McKeown

content: In order to lead the orchestra, you must first turn your back to the crowd.
author: Mike Mentzer

content: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
author: Andre Gide

content: It takes 20 years to build a reputation and five minutes to ruin it. If you think about that, you'll do things differently.
author: Warren Buffett

content: Holding onto your anger is like drinking poison and expecting the other person to die.
author: Buddha

content: Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are.
author: John Wooden

content: There is only one way to avoid criticism: do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
author: Aristotle

content: Treat everyone you meet as if they were you.
author: Doug Dillon

content: The reason we struggle with insecurity is because we compare our behind-the-scenes with everyone else’s highlight reel.
author: Steve Furtick

content: If people are doubting how far you can go, go so far that you can’t hear them anymore.
author: Michele Ruiz

content: Others can stop you temporarily. You are the only one who can do it permanently.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: He who angers you conquers you.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

content: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Ignore people playing status games. They gain status by attacking people playing wealth creation games.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Inner Vs Outer Scorecard: Would you rather be the world’s greatest lover, but have everyone think you’re the world’s worst lover? Or would you rather be the world’s worst lover but have everyone think you’re the world’s greatest lover?
author: Warren Buffett

content: If you live in harmony with nature you will never be poor; if you live according what others think, you will never be rich.
author: Seneca

content: If you are not at the table, then you are probably on the menu.
author: Michael Enzi

content: Loose lips, sink ships.
author: English Proverb

content: Better an open enemy than a false friend.
author: Proverb

content: It is better to be envied than to be pitied.
author: Herodotus

content: Better die standing than live kneeling.
author: Emiliano Zapata

content: A lean compromise is better than a fat lawsuit.
author: George Herbert

content: Flattery is like cologne water, to be smelt, not swallowed
author: Josh Billings

content: You can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar.
author: Proverb

content: You can lead a horse to water, but you can’t make it drink.
author: Proverb

content: You can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
author: Proverb

content: Let everyone sweep in front of his own door, and the whole world will be clean.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
author: Sun Tzu

content: The enemy of my enemy is my friend.
author: Sun Tzu

content: If the enemy of my enemy is my friend, then a friend of my enemy, is my enemy.
author: Pyreglide

content: An empty vessel makes much noise.
author: Proverb

content: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
author: Proverb

content: If you’re too sweet, you’ll be eaten up; if you’re too bitter, you’ll be spat out.
author: Proverb

content: Books and friends should be few but good.
author: Proverb

content: The more acquaintances you have, the less you know them.
author: Proverb

content: Make happy those who are near, and those who are far will come.
author: Proverb

content: Who makes himself a sheep, will be eaten by wolves.
author: Proverb

content: A dwarf on a giant’s shoulders sees the farther of the two.
author: Proverb

content: Use soft words and hard arguments.
author: English Proverb

content: Hurt people hurt people.
author: Proverb

content: Don't judge a book by its cover.
author: Proverb

content: People in glass houses shouldn't throw stone.
author: Proverb

content: You can't make an omelete without breaking a few eggs.
author: Proverb

content: If you can't change the people around you, then you must change the people around you.
author: Proverb

content: In relationship, the one who needs the other the most is the least powerful of the two.
author: Proverb

content: You have the choice to be one of two types of people: One who brings happiness whenever he comes in the room. One who brings happiness whenever he goes out of the room.
author: Proverb

content: If you want to see who rules over you, see who you're not allowed to criticize.
author: Proverb

content: When you leash a dog, you are as much a slave to him as he is to you.
author: Proverb

content: If you're better than people, they will envy you. If you're worse than people, they will pity you. If you're equal to people, they will compete with you. If you are different than people, they will reject you. If you're same as people, only then they may accept you.
author: Proverb

content: You want to be rich and anonymous, not poor and famous.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: First become rich. Then be a philosopher.
author: Shah Rukh Khan

content: There is nothing more useless than doing something well which shouldn’t be done at all.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Meetings are by definition a concession to deficient organization. For one either meets or one works. One cannot do both at the same time.
author: Peter Drucker

content: Stop allowing your day to day life to be clouded by busy nothingness.
author: Steve Maraboli

content: To get something you’ve never had, you must do something you’ve never done.
author: Marc & Angel

content: Here’s the definition of successful failure: A few errors in judgment repeated every day. Here’s a secret to success: A few simple disciplines practiced every day.
author: Jim Rohn

content: If you don’t have a competitive advantage, don’t compete.
author: Jack Welch

content: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
author: Mark Hughes

content: If we discipline ourselves, others won’t have to.
author: Shiv Khera

content: On procrastination: Mother used to tell us that old Uncle Hank was always going to do something, and he finally did. He died.
author: Art Garner

content: Most people fail in life not because they aim too high and miss, but because they aim too low and hit. And many never aim at all.
author: Les Brown

content: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

content: No work is stressful. It is your inability to manage your body, mind, and emotions that makes it.
author: Sadhguru

content: Before you climb the ladder, make sure it’s leaning up against the right building.
author: Steven Covey

content: He who knows he has enough is rich.
author: Tao Te Ching

content: In the short run, the market is a voting machine but in the long run, it is a weighing machine.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

content: It’s way better to do it badly than to not do it at all.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Compare yourself to who you were yesterday, not who someone else is today.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Don't be the best. Be the only.
author: Kevin Kelly

content: Lots of literacy in modern society, but not enough numeracy.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Learn to sell. Learn to build. If you can do both, you will be unstoppable.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Capital and labor are permissioned leverage. Everyone is chasing capital, but someone has to give it to you. Everyone is trying to lead, but someone has to follow you. Code and media are permissionless leverage. They’re the leverage behind the newly rich. You can create software and media that works for you while you sleep.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: I don’t care how rich you are, I don’t care whether you’re like a top Wall Street banker, if somebody can tell you when to be at work and what to wear and how to behave, you’re not a free person, you’re not actually rich.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: When you memorize, it’s an indication that you don’t understand. You should be able to rederive anything on the spot. And if you can’t, you don’t know it.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: The five most important skills are Reading, Writing, Arithmetic, Talking, and Coding.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: As long as I have a book in my hand, I don’t feel like I’m wasting time.
author: Charlie Munger

content: "After much observation of super-wealthy families, here's my recommendation," Buffett said in an update on his charitable giving: "Leave the children enough so that they can do anything but not enough that they can do nothing."
author: Warren Buffett

content: As a product, if you try to become everything for everyone before you become something for someone, you end up becoming nothing for no one.
author: Kunal Shah

content: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
author: Warren Buffett

content: I always advise young people to become good public speakers (top 25%). Anyone can do it with practice. If you add that talent to any other, suddenly you’re the boss of the people who have only one skill.
author: Tim Ferriss

content: What’s money? A man is a success if he gets up in the morning and goes to bed at night and in between does what he wants to do.
author: Bob Dylan

content: If you're born poor, it's not your mistake. But if you die poor, it is your mistake.
author: Bill Gates

content: You can lose money and make it back, you can't do that with time.
author: Tim Ferriss

content: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

content: If you want to achieve excellence, you can get there today. As of this second, quit doing less-than-excellent work.
author: Thomas J. Watson

content: When you do more than you’re paid for, eventually you’ll be paid for more than you do.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance; one cannot fly into flying.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

content: Hire character. Train skill.
author: Peter Schutz

content: If you are not taking care of your customer, your competitor will.
author: Bob Hooey

content: The golden rule for every businessman is this: Put yourself in your customer's place.
author: Orison Swett Marden

content: Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else.
author: J. M. Barrie

content: It's not just about being better. It's about being different. You need to give people a reason to choose your business.
author: Tom Abbott

content: Working hard for something we don't care about is called stress; working hard for something we love is called passion.
author: Simon Sinek

content: Learn from the mistakes of others. You can't live long enough to make them yourself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

content: If they don’t give you a seat at the table, bring a folding chair.
author: Shirley Chisholm

content: Education costs money. But then so does ignorance.
author: Sir Claus Moser

content: You can get everything in life you want if you will just help enough other people get what they want.
author: Zig Ziglar

content: If you believe something needs to exist, if it's something you want to use yourself, don't let anyone ever stop you from doing it.
author: Tobias Lütke

content: The world is changing very fast. Big will not beat small anymore. It will be the fast beating the slow.
author: Rupert Murdoch

content: If you look for perfection, youwill never be "content".
author: Leo Tolstoy

content: If you don’t build your dream, someone else will hire you to help them build theirs.
author: Dhirubhai Ambani

content: When you innovate, you’ve got to be prepared for everyone telling you you’re nuts.
author: Larry Ellison

content: If you hire people just because they can do a job, they’ll work for your money. But if you hire people who believe what you believe, they’ll work for you with blood and sweat and tears.
author: Simon Sinek

content: Focus on being productive instead of busy.
author: Tim Ferriss

content: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

content: The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and a monthly salary.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

content: You’re not going to get rich renting out your time. You must own equity, a piece of a business, to gain your financial freedom.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You will get rich by giving society what it wants but does not yet know how to get. At scale.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Leverage is a force multiplier for your judgment.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You should be too busy to “do coffee” while still keeping an uncluttered calendar.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Set and enforce an aspirational personal hourly rate. If fixing a problem will save less than your hourly rate, ignore it. If outsourcing a task will cost less than your hourly rate, outsource it.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Work as hard as you can. Even though who you work with and what you work on are more important than how hard you work.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Technology democratizes consumption but consolidates production. The best person in the world at anything gets to do it for everyone.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: If you don’t own a piece of a business, you don’t have a path towards financial freedom.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You’re never going to get rich renting out your time.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Forty hour work weeks are a relic of the Industrial Age. Knowledge workers function like athletes: Train and sprint, then rest and reassess.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: If you want to be part of a great tech company, then you need to be able to Sell or Build. If you don’t do either, learn.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: Earn with your mind, not your time.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You don’t get rich by spending your time to save money. You get rich by saving your time to make money.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You want to look for professions and careers where the inputs and outputs are highly disconnected.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You can’t be normal and expect abnormal returns.
author: Naval Ravikant

content: You must determine where you are going in your life, because you cannot get there unless you move in that direction. Random wandering will not move you forward. It will instead disappoint and frustrate you and make you anxious and unhappy and hard to get along with and then resentful, and then vengeful, and then worse.
author: Jordan Peterson

content: Freedom will only come when you no longer trade your time for money.
author: Andrew Tate

content: Doing something unimportant well does not make it important.
author: Tim Ferriss

content: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy, All play and no work makes Jack a mere toy.
author: Proverb

content: A poor carpenter always blames his tools.
author: Proverb

content: Don’t kill the goose that lays golden eggs.
author: Proverb

content: The highest branch is not the safest roost.
author: Proverb

content: To know the road ahead, ask those coming back.
author: Proverb

content: While the cat is away, the mice will play.
author: Proverb

content: If you can’t beat ’em, join ’em.
author: Proverb

content: One man’s junk is another man’s treasure.
author: Proverb

content: Better to have money and not need it than to need money and not have it.
author: Anonymous

content: Better a steady dime than a rare dollar.
author: Proverb

content: He that hath no silver in his purse should have silk in his tongue.
author: Proverb

content: Don’t empty the water jar until the rain falls.
author: Proverb

content: Look after the pennies and the pounds will look after themselves.
author: Proverb

content: He is rich who owes nothing.
author: Proverb

content: If you’re not paying, you’re the product.
author: Proverb

content: He who does not ask will never get a bargain.
author: Proverb

content: If you buy cheaply, you pay dearly.
author: Proverb

content: If you buy quality, you only cry once.
author: Proverb

content: When winds of change blow, some build walls and others build windmills.
author: Proverb

content: If you suspect a man, don’t employ him, and if you employ him, don’t suspect him.
author: Proverb

content: Many hands make light work.
author: Proverb

content: Criminal lawyers see bad people at their best. Divorce lawyers see good people at their worst.
author: Proverb

content: When there is a gold rush, you don't want to be digging for gold. You want to be selling the shovels.
author: Proverb

content: If you "follow the money" when you invest, you're too late to the game. You need to research and determine where the money will be going.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

content: On product development: First make it work. Then make it better.
author: Anonymous

content: Always trade money for time and knowledge. Because money can be lost and gained. But time once lost cannot be gained. And knowledge once gained cannot be lost.
author: Proverb

content: On Coding: Make it work. Make it right. Make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

content: Have big dreams and small goals. The bigger the dream the stronger you'll be emotionally. The smaller the goal the sharper you'll be mentally.
author: Anonymous

content: The best way to learn something is to need that something. Learning when you don't really need to is a good way to give up early. Learning when there's something you truly need to do, but can't, but could, is the right time to figure something out.
author: Jason Fried

content: I had a friend, I had some money, I loaned my friend the money. Now I have no friend and I have no money.
author: Ann Landers

content: Charity begins at home.
author: Proverb

content: Necessity is mother of invention.
author: Proverb

content: The first casualty of any war is truth.
author: Proverb

content: What you listen to and who you listen to is what you become.
author: Gary Veynerchuk

content: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

content: Anything that can be written in JavaScript, eventually will be writter in JavaScript.
author: James Atwood

content: As a software developer, you can only feel two emotions. Imposter Syndrome or superiority complex.
author: Anonymous

content: On Serverless Architecture: No Server is easier to manage than no server.
author: Werner Vogels

content: Data is the new oil. It’s valuable, but if unrefined it cannot really be used.
author: Clive Humby

content: You need to control two things to run a country. Streets and institutions.
author: Proverb

content: Shake with your right hand, but hold a rock with your left.
author: Frank Underwood

content: In politics, there are no permanent friends or enemies, only permanent interests.
author: Patience Johnson

content: To improve is to change. To perfect is to change often.
author: Winston Churchill

content: If you fail to plan, you plan to fail.
author: Winston Churchill

content: Without music life would be a mistake.
author: Frederick Nietche

content: If more information was the answer, then we'd all be billionaires with perfect abs.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Do what you’d do if you were the only person on Earth.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Busy is what happens when you’re at the mercy of someone else’s schedule.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Don’t answer a hard question too quickly. Don’t stop at the first answer. In mystery stories, the first suspect is not the culprit.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Don’t be consistent with your past self. Only idiots never change their mind.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Information doesn’t stick without emotion. You learn better when you’re having fun.
author: Derek Sivers

content: We’re clearly bad judges of our own creations. We should just put them out there and let the world decide.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Pain’s power relies on surprise. If you expect it, it’s weaker. If you choose it, it’s gone.
author: Derek Sivers

content: I had to make myself unnecessary to the running of my company.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Here’s how to live: Do whatever you want now.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Since you can’t avoid problems, just find good problems. Happiness isn’t everlasting tranquility. Happiness is solving good problems.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Any business that’s in business to sell you a cure is motivated not to focus on prevention.
author: Derek Sivers

content: We want to see the world clearly and know what’s what. But once we’re past the first stage of wisdom, the next stage involves adapting to new changes. We don’t get wise just by adding and adding. We also need to subtract.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Delegate but don't abdicate.
author: Derek Sivers

content: Trust, but verify. Remember it when delegating. You have to do both.
author: Derek Sivers

content: A bad goal makes you say, “I want to do that some day.” A great goal makes you take action immediately.
author: Derek Sivers

content: A big difference between being self-employed and being a business owner. Being self-employed feels like freedom until you realize that if you take time off, your business crumbles. To be a true business owner, make it so that you could leave for a year, and when you came back, your business would be doing better than when you left.
author: Derek Sivers

content: You can have everything, just not all at once.
author: Oprah Winfrey

content: Friends make the worst enemies.
author: Frank Underwood

content: If you haven't read hundreds of books, you are functionally illiterate, and you will be incompetent, because your personal experience isn't broad enough to sustain you.
author: Jim Mattis

content: To win in the marketplace you must first win in the workplace.
author: Doug Conant

content: We don't do commercials because our target audience isn't sitting around and watching TV.
author: Lamborghini

content: An old friend is better than two new ones.
author: Russian Proverb

content: An idiot admires complexity. A genius admires simplicity.
author: Terry Davis

content: Don't wish it were easier. Wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
author: Jim Rohn

content: We must all suffer one of two things: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret or disappointment.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Either you run the day or the day runs.
author: Jim Rohn

content: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.
author: Jim Rohn

content: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.
author: Jim Rohn

content: If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse
author: Jim Rohn

content: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
author: Jim Rohn

content: You never really know you’re addicted until you try to quit.
author: Anonymous

content: If we see a problem, but if we don't see a solution, then we're the problem. But if we see the problem and we see the solution, we've got ourselves a calling.
author: Anonymous

content: What comes easy won't last. What lasts won't come easy.
author: Ntsiki KaCaleni

content: Never memorize something that you can look up.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Before one million comes one.
author: Motherjane

content: The most dangerous person is the one who is articulate.
author: Jordan B. Peterson

content: Basic law of geopolitics. You can change your allies, your rivals, your enemies. But you cannot change your neighbors.
author: Anonymous

content: In geopolitics, there are no permanent friends or enemies. Only permanent interests.
author: Caron Moseley Braun

content: Everything in moderation. Especially moderation.
author: Oscar Wilde

content: If you can't make it better, don't make it worse.
author: Anonymous

content: People who fight fire with fire usually end up with ashes.
author: Pauline Phillips

content: One can have no smaller or greater mastery, than mastery of the self.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

content: You need to have strong body, so others don't attack you. You need to have strong mind, so you don't attack you.
author: Anonymous

content: Your ability to speak freely is directly correlated to your insignificance.
author: Andrew Tate

content: It is the first responsibility of every citizen to question authority.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: The issue today is the same it has been throughtout all history, whether man shall be allowed to govern himself or be ruled by a small elite.
author: Thomas Jefferson

content: If you're not prepared to walk away, you can't negotiate.
author: Donald Trump

content: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river, and he is not the same man.
author: Heraclitus

content: Best code is no code at all.
author: Jeff Atwood

content: Take care of client,  and the business will take care of itself.
author: Charles B. Johnson

content: Having money and not needing it is better than needing money and not having it.
author: Anonymous

content: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

content: Constraint is key to both creativity and productivity. Work expands to fill the available time. Objects expands to fill the available space. Actions expands to fill the available energy. Expenses expands to fill the available money. Thoughts expands to fill the available information.
author: Proverb

content: If you can't dazzle them with brilliance, baffle them with bull.
author: W. C. Fields

content: If you can't build it, then you don't understand it.
author: Richard Feynman

content: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
author: Benjamin Franklin
